alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Owsley, southwestern Breathitt and central Lee Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 432 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maloney, or over Beattyville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... St. Helens and Enoch around 435 PM EDT. Booneville, Monica, Grass, Primrose, Stay, Vada and Williba around 440 PM EDT. Lone, Tallega, Canyon Falls, Fillmore, Widecreek, Chestnut Gap and Turin around 445 PM EDT. Athol, Lerose and Eversole around 450 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oakdale, Cowcreek, War Creek, Copebranch, Jetts Creek, Chenowee, Lawson, Turkey, Guerrant, Houston, Yeadon, Gentry, Elkatawa, Arnett, Canoe, Sebastian`s Branch, Talbert, Curt, Howard Creek, Crockettsville, Dumont, Inverness, Dalesburg and Morris Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
